byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and SHARIFULLAH SAHAK
byline.contributor: Mimi Wells contributed reporting from Forward Operating Base Bostick in Kunar Province, Afghanistan, and Ray Rivera from Kabul.

abstract: American and Afghan troops kill at least 115 insurgents as part of tough fight to gain control of critical corridor and resupply route to key American base in northeastern Afghanistan.
snippet: American and Afghan troops have killed at least 115 insurgents as part of a tough fight to gain control of a critical corridor in northeastern Afghanistan.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: American and Afghan troops have killed at least 115 insurgents as part of a tough fight to gain control of a critical corridor in northeastern Afghanistan.

headline.main: U.S. and Afghan Troops Battle to Control Key Route
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Afghan Troops Battle to Control Crucial Route
headline.seo: U.S. Troops Battle to Control Key Afghan Route
